summary: This New York Post article discusses various celebrities and political figures, including a trip to Africa involving former President Bill Clinton, actor Chris Tucker, and Kevin Spacey, who are traveling on Jeffrey Epstein's private plane. The article also speculates on political maneuverings involving Senator John McCain and Senator John Kerry ahead of the 2004 presidential race.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Clinton is mentioned as traveling through Africa with Chris Tucker and Kevin Spacey, launching initiatives and meeting with various leaders.

persons.name: Chris Tucker
persons.context: Tucker is traveling with Clinton and Spacey in Africa and is preparing for a role as a fictional president.

persons.name: Kevin Spacey
persons.context: Spacey is mentioned as part of the group traveling with Clinton in Africa.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is noted for flying Clinton, Tucker, and Spacey around Africa on his private plane.

persons.name: John McCain
persons.context: McCain is discussed in the context of potential political shifts and his relationship with John Kerry.

persons.name: John Kerry
persons.context: Kerry is mentioned as a potential presidential candidate and his relationship with McCain is speculated upon.

connections.description: Clinton and Tucker are traveling together in Africa.
Clinton and Spacey are part of the same group traveling in Africa.
Epstein is providing transportation for Clinton and his companions.
McCain and Kerry are discussed in the context of the upcoming presidential race.

events.title: Clinton's African Initiative
events.description: Clinton travels to Africa to launch initiatives and meet with leaders.

events.title: Potential McCain-Kerry Rivalry
events.description: Speculation arises about McCain potentially running with Kerry in the presidential race.

keyFacts: Bill Clinton is traveling through Africa with Chris Tucker and Kevin Spacey on Jeffrey Epstein's private plane.
Clinton is launching initiatives to provide land titles to poor people in Ghana.
There is speculation about John McCain potentially leaving the Republican Party to run with John Kerry in the 2004 presidential race.
Epstein is described as handling the finances for Leslie Wexner, a prominent figure in retail.
The article mentions a rumored meeting between McCain and Kerry at McCain's cabin.
